snippet.title: Apple Giving Away Top-Shelf Apps And Games For Five Year App Store Anniversary
snippet.description: Video Mac App Store (Photo credit: Wikipedia) Apple's App Store celebrates its fifth anniversary this week, and Apple has some nice rewards for anyone that happens to be searching through the app store today. The company has put a suite of top-shelf apps and games on the ultimate sale today, knocking them [...] read »

snippet.title: Why Price An App At $4? Because It Makes Price Cut Campaigns Really Pop
snippet.description: Finnish app vendor Frogmind made a contrarian decision by pricing its iOS game "Badland" at $4 last spring. The mobile game market has moved decisively towards free downloads over the past two years. There is only one paid app in the Top 20 revenue chart of iPhone apps today in America [...] read »

snippet.title: 5 Reasons Why Finnish Apps Are Beating American Rivals On US iPad Market
snippet.description: November 21 was another high point for Finnish app industry. FDG Entertainment's "Oceanhorn" reigned as #1 iPad download in America and Rovio's "Angry Birds Star Wars 2" held onto #5 slot. Supercell's two games were lodged as #2 and #3 grossing US iPad apps. This meant that three Finnish companies held [...] read »

snippet.title: Nordic Start-up Funding Heating Up
snippet.description: Sweden has been long a focus of European start-up funding - in 2012, it attracted more venture capital money per capita than any other European country, absorbing nearly 20% of all European VC funding. But in 2013, Finland has also started showing a pulse as the country's role as a [...] read »
